info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 9:50PM EDT until August 18 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
FFWPHI
The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... Central Burlington County in southern New Jersey...
* Until 1215 AM EDT.
* At 950 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate another area of showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rain will arrive across the warned area from the west. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain has fallen from the first round. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas.
* Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Willingboro, Medford, Lumberton, Mount Holly, Pemberton, Leisuretowne, Cinnaminson, Nws Office, Pemberton Heights and Moorestown-Lenola.
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
